Teaching Assistant: Student’s Portfolio Showcase

In Fall 2016, I was the teaching assitant for Programming User Interface, a course that covers the how-tos of prototyping and designing interfaces. As the TA, I taught the lab section of the course where students learned the basics of prototyping with HTML/CSS/javascript. This page showcased the learning results.

Intermanual Apparent Tactile Motion

A work exploring the usage of haptic (touch) illusions in enriching media content. A ideal balance of psychology research and Human-Computer Interaction design.

Feel Effect: Enriching Storytelling with Haptic Feedback

Using meaningful haptic signals to deliver semantic meanings in stories for children.

Beacon: Decision Aid for COPD Patients

Creating a tool to educate patients about risks and benefits of each treatment for severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and help them connect their values and individual circumstances with their treatment choice.

Firefly: A Smart Ticket Enhancing Concert Experience

A smart ticket that could offer feedback and encouragement to the audience whenever they participate in a concert.

Chance: A Dating App for Bikers

Chance is a conceptual app that tracks your biking commute and matches you with other bike commuters in your area.

The Red Thread – A Visual Book

An accordion book of an original short story about fate and love, based on a traditional Chinese myth.

Monogram

Explore various letter forms through sketching.

Other Things

A short collection of other things I explored
